paragraph: Minutes of meetings, annual statements, stock records, financial ledgers and journal, ore production records, personnel records, and tax records of a silver-lead mine in the Lelande Mining District of the Coeur d'Alene region of northern Idaho.

title: Sherman Development Company Records
paragraph: Minute of meetings, general correspondence, ledger and journal, tax returns, list of Day family stock purchases, assay slips and accident reports of a lead-silver mine in the Lelande Mining District of the Coeur d'Alene mining region of northern Idaho.

title: Oreano Mining Company Records
paragraph: Minutes of meetings, by-laws, stock ledgers and journals, stock assessment records, voucher registers, cashbooks, bank statements, and paid checks of a silver-lead mine in the Lelande Mining District of the Coeur d'Alene region of northern Idaho.

title: Benton Mining Company Records
paragraph: Records relating to meetings of the stockholders, correspondence with stockholders, stock ledgers and journals, assessment records, invoices, a cash book, payrolls, and income and property tax records of a silver-lead mine in the Lelande Mining District of the Coeur d'Alene region of Idaho.

title: Dayrock Mining Company Records
paragraph: Minutes of meetings, financial statements, correspondence with suppliers and stockholders, annual statements, reports to federal and state agencies, stock ledgers and journals, assessment records, lists of stockholders, financial ledgers and journals, voucher registers, ore settlement records, mill reports, and payroll and other personnel records of a silver-lead mine in the Placer Center Mining District of the Coeur d'Alene mining region in Northern Idaho.

title: Strattons Mines Company Records
paragraph: Notices and agendas for annual meeting, correspondence with suppliers, a stock journal, lists of stockholders, check registers, and payroll records of a silver-lead mine in the Placer Center Mining District of the Coeur d'Alene mining region of northern Idaho.

title: Option Mining Company Records
paragraph: Bylaws, minutes of meetings, deeds, lists of stockholders, annual reports and statements, correspondence with stockholders, stock ledgers and journals, assessment records, check registers, bank account books, and property and income tax records of a silver-lead mine in the Placer Mining District of the Coeur d'Alene mining region of northern Idaho.

title: Sunshine Mining Company Records
paragraph: Minutes and other documents relating to meetings, stock ledger and journal, financial ledger, and cashbook for a silver-lead mine in the Beaver Mining District of the Coeur d'Alene mining region of northern Idaho.

title: Coeur D'Alene Mining & Smelting Company Records
paragraph: Minutes of meetings, a stock ledger and journal, and federal and state tax returns of a mine in the Placer Center Mining District of the Coeur d'Alene mining region of northern Idaho.

title: Happy Day Mining Company Records
paragraph: Minutes of meetings, financial statements, correspondence with stockholders, financial statements, reports to state agencies, a stock ledger, stock audits, assessment records, a financial ledger and cashbook, a voucher register, tax returns, and other records of a mine in the Coeur d'Alene mining region of northern Idaho.

title: Duluth Mining Company Records
paragraph: Minutes of meetings, financial statements, correspondence with suppliers and stockholders, annual statements, a stock ledger, cancelled stock certificates, assessment records, a financial ledger and journal, check registers, tax returns, and other records of a mine in the Lelande Mining District of the Coeur d'Alene mining region of northern Idaho.

title: Crystal Lead Mines Company Records
paragraph: Records of the Crystal Lead Mines Company, and its predecessor, Lead Crystals Mining Company, operators of a lead mine in the Eagle Mining District, north of Murray, Idaho, in the Coeur d'Alene mining region. Includes minutes and other records of the meetings of directors and stockholders, financial statements, correspondence, annual statements and reports to state agencies, stock ledgers and journals, stock assessment records, financial ledgers and journals, payroll records, tax returns, and other records.

title: Phoenix Mining and Milling Company Records
paragraph: Minutes of meetings, financial statements, correspondence, annual statements and reports to state agencies, a stock ledger, cancelled stock certificates, assessment records, and other records of a silver-lead mine in the Summit Mining District of the Coeur d'Alene mining region of northern Idaho.

title: C & R Mining Company Records
paragraph: Minutes of meetings, financial statements, correspondence, annual statements and reports, stock assessment records, financial journals, a voucher register, capital stock tax returns, and other records of a silver-lead mine in the Leland Mining District of the Coeur d'Alene mining region of northern Idaho.

title: Hornsilver Mining and Milling Company Records
paragraph: Minutes of meetings, financial statements, correspondence, stock ledgers and journals, assessment records, lists of stockholders, financial ledgers and journal, a voucher register, check register, tax returns, and other records of a mine in the Placer Center Mining District of the Coeur d'Alene mining region of northern Idaho.

title: Gold Hunter Mines Records
paragraph: Minutes of meetings, financial statements, general correspondence, annual statements, stock ledger, cancelled stock certificates, financial ledgers and journals, appraisals, tax returns, and other records of a silver-lead mine in the Hunter Mining District of the Coeur d'Alene mining area of northern Idaho, organized successively as Gold Hunter Mining and Smelting Company, Gold Hunter Mines, and Gold Hunter Mining Company.

title: Ben Hur Mining Company Records
paragraph: By-laws, minutes of meetings, annual reports, financial statements, correspondence with stockholders, stock ledgers and journals, assessment records, lists of stockholders, financial ledgers and journals, and tax returns of a silver-lead mining company in Mineral County, Montana.

title: Bryan Mining Company Records
paragraph: Financial ledger and journal, voucher register, and tax returns of a silver-lead mine in Saltese, Montana.

title: Last Chance Copper Mining Company Records
paragraph: Bylaws, minutes of meetings, financial statements, correspondence concerning mine operations, letters from stockholders, annual statements, stock ledgers and journals, canceled stock certificates, assessment records, lists of stockholders, financial ledgers and journals, vouchers, check registers, and tax returns of a Mineral County, Montana, copper mining company.

title: Woodburn Mining Company Records
paragraph: Minutes of meetings, annual statements and reports to state agencies, stock ledgers and journals, assessment records, and tax returns of a Mineral County, Montana, mining company.

title: Wilbur Mining Company Records
paragraph: Minutes of meetings, correspondence with stockholders, annual statements and reports to state agencies, a stock ledger, canceled stock certificates, a cash book, tax returns, and a workmen's time book of a small silver-lead mine in the Coeur d'Alene mining region of northern Idaho.

title: Western Union Mining Company Records
paragraph: Minutes of meetings, correspondence with stockholders and suppliers, annual statements and reports to state agencies, records relating to stock assessments and transfers, stock ledgers and a stock journal, financial ledgers and statements, records relating to ore shipment and production, and time books and payrolls of a silver-lead mining company in the Evolution Mining District of the Coeur d'Alene mining region of Idaho.

title: Treasure Vault Mining Company Records
paragraph: Minutes of meetings, financial statements, general correspondence, annual statements and reports to state agencies, stock ledgers and journals, assessment records, lists of stockholders, financial ledgers and journals, vouchers, check registers, and tax returns of a small silver-lead-zinc mine in the Placer Center Mining District of the Coeur d'Alene mining region of northern Idaho.

title: Success Mining Company Records
paragraph: Records relating to the meetings of the directors and stockholders, correspondence concerning mine operations, correspondence with stockholders and suppliers, financial statements, tax returns, leases, ore contracts, ore shipment records, information on the sale of equipment, capital stock records, financial records, and accident and payroll records of a zinc mine in the Placer Center Mining District of the Coeur d'Alene mining region of Idaho.

title: Stanley Mining Company Records
paragraph: Minutes of meetings, financial statements, correspondence with stockholders, reports to state agencies, stock ledgers and journals, assessment records, lists of stockholders, financial ledgers and journals, check registers, and tax returns of a silver-lead mine in the Lelande Mining District of the Coeur d'Alene mining region of Idaho. Some of the records in this group represent a predecessor corporation, the Stanley Consolidated Mining and Milling Company.

title: Trinum Mining Company Records
paragraph: Assays, correspondence with suppliers, general ledger sheets, state insurance fund claims, leases, ore records, payroll sheets, financial reports, a voucher register, and tax returns of a lead-zinc-silver mining partnership in the Coeur d'Alene mining region of Shoshone County, Idaho.

title: Pennsylvania Smelting Company Records
paragraph: Minutes of meetings, financial statements, correspondence with smelter personnel, a stock ledger, lists of stockholders, financial statements, balance sheets, check registers, and tax returns of a lead refinery and smelter located near Carnegie, Pennsylvania.

title: Cincinnati Mining Company Records
paragraph: Minutes of meetings, correspondence, annual financial statements, canceled stock certificates, assessment records, lists of stockholders, and tax returns of a lead-silver mine in the Hunter District of the Coeur d'Alene mining region of northern Idaho.

title: Dakins Company Records
paragraph: Financial statements, correspondence with suppliers, financial ledgers and journals, voucher and check registers, tax returns, insurance records, location notices, leases, mint reports, records of equipment sales and leasing, photographs of dredging operations, and other records of a gold dredging operation in the Grass Valley region of California.

title: Doro Company Records
paragraph: Correspondence; vouchers, check registers, and other financial records; and payroll records of a proposed dredging partnership on the Clearwater National Forest in northern Idaho.

title: Day Development Company Records
paragraph: Minutes, correspondence concerning company operations and potential mining properties, a capital stock ledger and journal, and financial records of a mineral exploration company based in Wallace, Idaho, and operating throughout the western United States. Included are records of a predecessor firm, the Hercules Exploration Company.

title: East Standard Mining Company Records
paragraph: Minutes of meetings, a stock ledger, cancelled stock certificates, tax records related to the final liquidating dividend of a mining company in the Lelande Mining District of the Coeur d'Alene mining region of northern Idaho.

title: Howard Company Records
paragraph: Business correspondence, financial statements, financial ledgers, tax returns, and payroll records of a placer mining partnership operating in Siskiyou County, California.

title: Mines Contracting Company Records
paragraph: Correspondence, a ledger, payroll records, and other records of a silver-lead mining partnership in the Coeur d'Alene mining region of northern Idaho.

title: Potosi Placers Records
paragraph: Correspondence, financial statements, contracts, insurance forms, drillers field logs, and vouchers of a placer mining partnership in the Beaver Mining District of the Coeur d'Alene mining region of northern Idaho.

title: Roxbury Placers Records
paragraph: Correspondence, reports, insurance records, tax returns, financial records, time books, and other records of a placer mine in Siskiyou County, California.

title: Sunset Lease Records
paragraph: Financial statements, correspondence with lease holders and others, reports to state agencies, a ledger, voucher registers, check registers, and payroll records of a silver-lead mining partnership in the Beaver Mining District of the Coeur d'Alene mining region of northern Idaho.

title: Diem Mines Limited Records
paragraph: Correspondence, minutes of meetings, financial statements, and other records relating to the operations of a group of silver-lead mining claims astride the United States-Canada boundary in the Metaline-Salmo region of British Columbia and Washington State. Also included are reports and circulars issued by the Mining Association of British Columbia (1959-1967).

title: Day Mines, Inc. Records
paragraph: Organizational records, correspondence, financial records, ore production and shipment records, personnel and payroll records, insurance records, and tax records of silver-lead-zinc mining company headquartered in Wallace, Idaho.

title: John H. Wourms Records
paragraph: Correspondence and legal documents of a mining corporation lawyer and his successor, Paul B. Jessup, of Wallace, Idaho, reflecting his association with the Hercules Mining Company and other Day family interests.

title: Robert P. Dwyer Papers
paragraph: Correspondence concerning leases, legislation, and legal documents concerning the Coeur d'Alene Lake Property Owner's Association and other topics.

title: Leonard Gilman Gaffney Papers
paragraph: Correspondence, tax returns, and other financial material relating to the various mining companies which eventually made up Day Mines, Inc. from the files of the firm's comptroller.

title: Wallace Press-Times Records
paragraph: Alphabetical correspondence file, minute book (1912-1956), and several financial journals of a Wallace, Idaho, newspaper.

title: Wallace Realty Company Records
paragraph: Minute books, stock records and financial records of the company formed to manage the Day family properties in Wallace and elsewhere. Also records of the sale of the Galena Home tracts in Osburn, Idaho.

title: Eleanor Bernice Day Boyce Records
paragraph: Correspondence and other material concerning the construction of an apartment house in Portland, Oregon, personal financial ledgers, journals, and check registers.

title: Lucy Mix Day Papers
paragraph: Personal financial records, including voucher registers, 1941-1969, and general ledgers, 1920-1969, of Mrs. Jerome Day.

title: Eugene Rufus Day Records
paragraph: Correspondence, legal documents, financial records for personal and business accounts, personal diaries and appointment books, and materials pertaining to the settlement of his estate.

title: Jerome James Day Papers
paragraph: Personal and business correspondence, including material related to the Tamarack and Custer Mine, Idaho National Harvester Co., labor troubles, and Idaho politics. Also personal financial records including ledgers and voucher registers.

title: Day Family Estates & Trusts Records
paragraph: Account ledgers, voucher registers, and other papers regarding estates, probate, and trusts established by Henry L. Day and Jerome J. Day.

title: Harry Loren Day Papers
paragraph: Correspondence relating to the Hercules Mining Company and personal correspondence, records relating to Day's activities with the State Bank of Commerce, 1905-1936; Federal Mining and Smelting Company, 1912-1921; his proprty and investments, such as Wallac Realty Co., and other mining activities. Other papers include Day's financial records, date books, and an early ore shipment record. Also included is an 1848 W.T. Sherman letter and an 1882 autographed portrait.

title: Henry Lawrence Vincent Day Papers
paragraph: Correspondence, financial records, technical reports, historical material, photographs, and other materials of the principal stockholder in Day Mines, Inc.

title: Kanaka Corporation Records
paragraph: General correspondence and other records concerning the dredging operation, tax returns, and financial records of a gold placer claim near Alleghany, Sierra County, California.

title: Fern Mining Company Records
paragraph: Minute book of a silver-lead mining company in the Placer Center Mining District of Coeur d'Alene mining region of northern Idaho.

title: Henry L. Day Foundation Records
paragraph: Correspondence, tax returns, ledger sheets and the check/voucher register of a small private non-profit foundation set up by Henry L. Day to distribute financial contributions to charitable organizations.

title: Anchor Group Records
paragraph: Reports and correspondence concerning the management of a lead-silver mine near Murray, Idaho.

title: Big Eight Group Records
paragraph: Correspondence regarding assessment work, leases, and management of a lead-silver mine near Troy, Montana.

title: Orofino Group Records
paragraph: The operation of a small lead-silver mine near Murray, in the Summit Mining district, Shoshone County, Idaho.

title: Hercules Oil and Gas Company Records
paragraph: Articles of incorporation of the Hercules Oil and Gas Co. and related correspondence from a Wilmington, Delaware, lawyer.

title: Magic Copper Mining Company Records
paragraph: Articles of incorporation, correspondence, and an application for patent on a copper mine in the St. Joe Mining District, Shoshone County, Idaho.

title: Sunset Mercantile Company Records
paragraph: Minutes and other records of annual meetings of directors and stockholders, 1938-1944; financial statements, 1935-1943; and correspondence of a Wallace, Idaho, brewery.

title: General Traffic Department Financial Records
paragraph: Correspondence, bank statements, paid checks, vouchers, and other records documenting financial transactions of the General Traffic Department, an office in Wallace, Idaho maintained jointly by mines and smelters to oversee ore shipments.

title: Western Timber Company Papers
paragraph: Tax returns, 1926-1931; financial statements, 1929-1931; and correspondence, 1929-1931, of a Harrison, Idaho, lumber company. Also copies of trustee deeds and related documents, 1914-1917, concerning the bankruptcy of Lane Lumber Company.

title: Wolverine Mining Company Papers
paragraph: List of stockholders and a draft of the report reorganizing the Coeur d'Alene Mining District's Wolverine Mining Co. to Yreka Mining Company.

title: Paramount Mines Papers
paragraph: Reports on the Paramount Mine, Coeur d'Alene Mining District, Idaho.

title: Aaron R. Gould Letters
subject: military;indigenous
paragraph: Twenty three letters written by Private Gould, a Nez Perce Indian, to his father, Owen J. Gould, regarding army life during World War II. Also a printed broadside, Nez Perce County Honor Roll (1945).

title: Fort Hall Account Books
subject: forts
paragraph: Financial journals and ledgers of this Oregon Trail post. Also included are papers relating to Nathaniel Jarvis Wyeth, 1834-1889. Photocopies from the Oregon Historical Society microfilm R-578.

title: Fort Hall Indian Reservation Economic Study
subject: indigenous;environmental;forts
paragraph: Correspondence and reports concerning the economic feasibility of converting rangeland on the Fort Hall Indian Reservation to dryland farming. Also oversize range management maps.

title: James R. Fazio Papers
paragraph: James R. Fazio was a forestry professor at the University of Idaho and was friends with author Michael Frome. This collection is his personal papers.

title: Clarence H. Sample Papers
subject: scrapbooks
paragraph: Scrapbook of university activities; letters from a girlfriend received while a forest lookout in Montana (1928); and photographs belonging to a University of Idaho student.

title: Robert Elroy McDole Papers
subject: environmental
paragraph: Chronological file of talks, papers, press releases, photographs showing soil conservation methods, a soil survey of the University of Idaho and related photographs, and bark study and soil testing reprints collected by a University of Idaho soil scientist.

title: Amos Yoder Papers
subject: government and politics
paragraph: Class lecture notes and related material, and an alphabetical file containing articles, news clippings, correspondence, and similar material, which is arranged by subject, collected by a University of Idaho professor of political science.

title: George Ellis Burcaw Papers
subject: professors
paragraph: Student papers, reprints, and correspondence relating to museology and the writings of G. Ellis Burcaw.

title: Herbert Sydney Duncombe Papers
subject: professors;government and politics
paragraph: Correspondence, memoranda, reports, course outlines and evaluations, and other materials concerning the organization of the Idaho Political Science Association, the teaching of political science, and research on Idaho election statistics.

title: Lambert Cornelius Erickson Papers
subject: professors;plants
paragraph: Class notes from courses taken at the Universities of Minnesota and Wyoming, publications on weeds, articles authored by Erickson, and photographs of weed and seed experiments and test plots.

title: William Edgar Borah Papers
subject: government and politics;legislators;photographs;speeches
paragraph: Bound speeches of Senator William E. Borah; photographs of Borah, Mrs. Borah, and others, including signed photographs of U.S. presidents Coolidge, Taft, and Hoover; political cartoons featuring Borah, including eight original pen and ink drawings.

title: Harry Harrison Caldwell Papers
subject: professors
paragraph: Correspondence, reports, notes, minutes, and other papers relating to the Department of Geography at the University of Idaho, teaching, research in recreation and urban planning, consulting, and involvement with groups for the hearing impaired, particularly Self Help for Hard of Hearing Persons (SHHH). There is also a collection of slides taken on trips throughout the Northwest and around the world.

title: Karen R. Davis Papers
subject: professors;students;schools
paragraph: Nutritional survey data from students at three high schools in Boise, Nampa, and Coeur d'Alene, Idaho, collected by Kathleen Warnick as part of a national survey of student nutrition (1951-1957). Included is information on meal patterns, diet histories, nutrient intake, servings of food eaten, and soup consumption. Also included is Karen Davis's correspondence with the high schools in an attempt to locate the students for a follow-up study (1979-1983).

title: F. Leontine Thomas Papers
subject: authors and writers;poets and poetry;manuscripts
paragraph: Typescripts and a few holograph copies of poems, anecdotes, short stories, and a novel, by Franklin Leontine Thomas. Also included is a printed volume of poetry, Rhymes from Idaho (Parma, Idaho: 1942).

title: Fred Herbert Winkler Papers
subject: professors;manuscripts
paragraph: Course and lecture outlines for courses taught at the University of Idaho and other institutions; typescripts and reprints of articles by Winkler; outlines, notes, and papers resulting from graduate and undergraduate study, including copies of Winkler's thesis and dissertation; articles about Winkler; newspaper and magazine articles on historical subjects.

title: Equinox Food Exchange Records
subject: clubs and organizations;pacific northwest
paragraph: Articles of incorporation, by-laws, minutes of meetings of the board of trustees, personnel records, policy manuals, correspondence, financial records, catalogs, and other records of a cooperative wholesale distributor for buyers and producers of natural foods in the inland Northwest.

title: Samuel S.M. Chan Papers
subject: professors;engineers and engineering;diversity, equity, and inclusion (dei);
paragraph: Charts, graphs, photographs, correspondence and articles written by Samuel S.M. Chan, U of I Professor of Metallurgical Engineer, 1962-1989.
image-alt: image of Samuel Chan

title: Rafe Gibbs Papers
subject: manuscripts
paragraph: Edited typescript (3 vols.) of Beacon for Mountain and Plain, by Rafe Gibbs; and materials used as exhibits at a reception at the University of Idaho honoring Gibbs and illustrator Alfred Dunn, May 14, 1989, including printed copies of Beacon for Mountain and Plain (1962) and Beckoning the Bold (1976), magazines containing articles by Gibbs, and a frame (ca. 11"x22.5") containing portraits of Gibbs and Dunn with a narrative about their collaboration.

title: Tau Kappa Epsilon (Alpha Delta) Records
subject: clubs and organizations
paragraph: Chapter membership directory; "History of Installation," the story of the founding of the Alpha Delta chapter, written by charter members; newsletters; rush brochures; and the local magazine, Teke AD.

title: Members of the [Idaho] Legislature Scrapbooks
subject: legislators;scrapbooks
paragraph: One volume, compiled by University of Idaho Alumni Secretary James Lyle, is a typewritten list of Idaho state legislators with notes on their connection, if any, to the university. The remainder of the collection comprises biographical sketches of legislators clipped from newspapers.

title: Epsilon Sigma Phi. Theta Chapter Records
subject: clubs and organizations
paragraph: Records of the Theta Chapter of Epsilon Sigma Phi at the University of Idaho. Included are by-laws, correspondence, financial records, minutes, newsletters and yearbooks.

title: Columbia River Inter-Tribal Fish Commission Records
subject: indigenous;fishing and fisheries;minutes;diversity, equity, and inclusion (dei);
paragraph: Minutes, agendas, reports, and other documents relating to Native American fisheries, distributed to Columbia River Inter-Tribal Fish Commission members and collected by Robert Strom, commission member representing the Nez Perce Tribe.
image-alt: Columbia River Inter-Tribal Fish Commission logo

title: U.S. Bureau Of Entomology And Plant Quarantine Field Station Reports
subject: pacific northwest
paragraph: Weekly, monthly, quarterly, and annual reports from stations chiefly in Idaho, Oregon, and Washington state concerning pea weevils, pea aphids, and sugar beet insects. Included are a few similar reports issued by the University of Idaho Research and Extension centers at Kimberly and Tetonia, and other agencies.

title: George Arthur Williams Papers
subject: professors;geology
paragraph: Correspondence, articles, speeches, minutes of meetings, and other papers of George Arthur Williams (1918- ), professor of geology at the University of Idaho, 1957-1988. Included are correspondence, a report on, and notes of, a student study of mercury contamination in the Jordan Creek drainage near Silver City, Idaho.

title: John Richard Hoskins Papers
subject: professors;engineers and engineering
paragraph: Correspondence, reports, and other material concerning field trips, short courses given at the Northwest Mining Association annual meetings, and other activities as head of the Mining Engineering and Metallurgy Department at the University of Idaho, as a professional engineer, and as a teacher.

title: J. Blaine Anderson Case Files
subject: judges;legal documents;idaho
paragraph: The case files of Judge J. Blaine Anderson span the years 1972 to 1988, with the bulk of the material covering his years on the appeals court, 1976 to 1988. The papers include legal briefs, opinions, and other documents, memos and manuscript notes concerning cases the judge heard as District Court Judge and Appeals Court Judge. The most extensive files are the Nevada Paiute Indian water rights case and the Sun Valley Airline crash case.

title: Robert W. Clark Papers
subject: professors;business
paragraph: Tests and lecture notes for his classes at the University of Idaho, other university related material, papers related to his professional activities as a Certified Public Accountant, and other papers.

title: Weber Mines Papers
paragraph: Personal and business correspondence, legal papers, financial records, and smelter returns maintained by the three members of the Weber family (Frederick A., Frank C., and Caro Lou) operating a silver mine near Lakeview, Idaho.

title: Idaho Partners of the Americas Records
subject: clubs and organizations
paragraph: Articles of incorporation, by-laws, and related records, correspondence, financial and membership records, newsletters and other materials relating to a cultural exchange program between Idaho and Ecuador.

title: Barnard Stockbridge Ledgers and Other Papers
subject: photographs
paragraph: Nellie Stockbridge's negative ledgers, and material from the files of Special Collections concerning the Barnard photographic studio in Wallace, Idaho.

title: Moscow Lodge 249 Benevolent And Protective Order Of Elks Records
subject: clubs and organizations;moscow;minutes
paragraph: Minutes of the meetings of the board of trustees, 1943-1966; financial records, 1951-1980, dimit records, daily calendars of events, visitors registers, and other records of this fraternal organization.

title: 4-H Clubs of Idaho Records
subject: clubs and organizations
paragraph: Annual reports, manuals, programs from state congresses, information on several 4-H camps, photographs, and club scrapbooks maintained by the state 4-H club historian.

title: Joshua Harlan Carey Papers
subject: clubs and organizations;idaho;scrapbooks;photographs;agriculture
paragraph: Correspondence, both personal and professional; papers relating to Dr. Carey's personal interests such as bird watching; items concerning his professional life as a pediatric neurologist; financial records, both personal and professional; and a collection of 16 mm. movie film documenting Dr. Elizabeth Crosby's neurological research using monkeys.

title: Elaine Anderson Mansius Papers
subject: idaho;alumni;students;women
paragraph: Letters to family and memorabilia of a University of Idaho student in the 1940s.

title: Bunker Hill Company Records
paragraph: Organizational records, correspondence, financial records, legal records, capital stock records, personnel records, scrapbooks, company news letters, photographs and maps of a large lead-zinc mine and smelter headquartered in Kellogg, Idaho. Also records of affiliated and subsidiary companies, such as Pend Oreille Mines and Metals, Reeves MacDonald Mining Company, and Caledonia Mining Company.

title: Siegfried B. Rolland Papers
subject: professors
paragraph: Papers relating to history professor Rolland's work on university and statewide committees, lecture notes and other material related to his teaching, material documenting his historical research, especially on Cadwallader Colden, notebooks from his graduate student days, and correspondence, both professional and personal.

title: Faculty Women's Club Papers
subject: clubs and organizations;women
paragraph: Notebook of policies and procedures, minutes, treasurer's records, membership directories, and recprds covering special events and projects of the Faculty Women's Club which was active on the University of Idaho campus from 1913 to 1993.

title: United Brotherhood of Carpenters And Joiners of America. Local 313 Records
subject: labor unions;moscow;women;photographs
paragraph: Administrative material such as minutes of meetings and financial records, and hiring and other employment records for the Carpenter's Union in Moscow, Idaho. Also included are records for the Ladies Auxiliary of the Carpenters Union.

title: Mortar Board Records
subject: diversity, equity, and inclusion (dei);
paragraph: Meeting minutes, correspondence, activity plans, and plaques awarded by this honor society at the University of Idaho.
image-alt: Mortar Board women riding in convertible car during parade

title: Moscow Fine Arts Club Records
subject: clubs and organizations;moscow
paragraph: Constitution and by-laws, minutes of meetings, programs, yearbooks, and scrapbooks of this Moscow, Idaho women's club dedicated to the promotion of music and the fine arts.

title: University of Idaho Area Education Office Personnel Association Records
subject: clubs and organizations;women;scrapbooks
paragraph: Constitution and by-laws, executive committee minutes, correspondence, information on workshops and financial records of an organization for education of office personnel at the University of Idaho and Latah County.

title: Edwin Fulwider Papers
subject: interviews;idaho
paragraph: Materials collected by Fulwider about the residents of Lakeview, Idaho : included are reminiscences and correspondence of Nan (Annie Margery) Scanlon about her life in the Lake Pend Oreille region of northern Idaho, taped interviews with George Cerveny, Margaret Chalfont, Caro Lou Weber and Leo Ambrose Payne, and other materials.

title: Wallace G. Woolf Papers
paragraph: Articles, speeches, correspondence and patents of Wallace G. Woolf, metallurgical engineer at the Bunker Hill Mining Company.

title: John Albright Schenk Papers
paragraph: Research data concerning forest entomology research conducted by John A. Schenk, Molly Stock, and Karel Stoszek; includes maps, photographs and microscope slides.

title: Paul George Eimers Papers
subject: legal documents;idaho;lawyers
paragraph: Client files and personal papers of Grangeville lawyers Paul G. Eimers, Asa Hardy and Berchmans Auger.

title: Harold Lyman Ryan Papers
paragraph: Case files of 9th District Court Judge Harold L. Ryan; includes court documents, trial notes, and memos of law clerks. Also office administrative files.

title: Herman Robert Otness Papers
subject: professors;genealogy;education
paragraph: Lecture notes, classroom materials, tests and other papers of psychology professor Otness; materials relating to his wartime testing work for the U.S. Navy; correspondence and clippings about the Rainier State School at Buckley, WA. Also professional clippings, educational testing materials, correspondence and other personal material, including those relating to local historian Lillian Otness, and other materials.

title: Francis V. Nonini Papers
subject: students
paragraph: Classroom notes and papers of university student Francis V. Nonini.

title: Allen Sheeley Janssen Papers
subject: professors;engineers and engineering;military;idaho
paragraph: Personal and professional papers of engineering professor Allen Janssen concerning administration, teaching, research, and civic activities.

title: Latah County, Idaho Records
subject: government and politics;latah county
paragraph: Records of the auditor (as auditor, recorder, clerk of the court, and clerk of the county commission), treasurer, and assessor of Latah County, Idaho.

title: Latah County, Idaho. Sheriff Records
subject: latah county
paragraph: Bound volumes of Sheriff's ledgers, 1895-1977, Sheriff's journal and cashbook, 1895-1917, Sheriff's fee book, 1891-1927, Sheriff's sale and execution docket, 1933-1976, Records of prisoners, 1914-1982, and budgets, 1972-1984.

title: Kendrick State Bank Records
subject: banks and banking;latah county
paragraph: Organizational and financial records filed with the Clerk of the District Court, Latah County, relating to the dissolution of Kendrick State bank, Kendrick, Idaho.

title: Luna House register
subject: nez perce county;business
paragraph: This collection consists of a guest register from the Luna House Hotel and Stage Office in Lewiston, Idaho covering the years 1862-1864.

title: Abe McGregor Goff Papers
subject: government and politics;photographs;scrapbooks;legal documents;world wars;lawyers
paragraph: Personal records of U.S. Representative Abe Goff, including clippings, scrapbooks, photographs, and correspondence. Also records relating to his career in the military, his law office in Moscow, and his political career, including service as Soliciter for the Post Office Dept. and as Interstate Commerce Commission commissioner.

title: George Shihei Shitamae Papers
subject: concentration camps;underrepresented communities;world wars;idaho;washington;montana
paragraph: Letters to Shitamae, interned in Santa Fe, New Mexico, from his relatives interned at Camp Harmony located in Puyallup, Washington, and the Minidoka Internment Camp in Hunt, Idaho, passing on news of the family and discussing conditions in the camps. Also included are exercises in English language and grammar, and a hand written diary in Japanese from the internment camp at Fort Missoula, Montana.

title: Potlatch Corporation, Pres-to-log Division Records
subject: business
paragraph: Correspondence, leases, photographs, and engineering drawings pertaining to the manufacture and marketing of Pres-to-logs by Potlatch Corporation and Wood Briquettes, Inc.

title: William Healy Papers
subject: legal documents;lawyers
paragraph: Case files of Silver City lawyer William Healy.

title: Lily Wai Committee Papers
subject: underrespresented communities;idaho;women;diversity, equity, and inclusion (dei);

title: Latah County Oral History Project
subject: latah county;interviews;immigrants;farms and farming;lumbering;logging;business;women;teachers;railroads

title: William Craig Donation Land Claim Records

title: Charles A. Webbert Papers
subject: clubs and organizations;pacific northwest;genealogy

The papers include correspondence, reports, minutes, organizational and other papers relating to the PNLA, in addition to genealogical information related to Webbert’s family.

title: Carla Emery Papers
subject: correspondence;manuscripts;farms and farming
paragraph: Carla Emery was a believer in self-sufficiency and the “back to the land” philosophy. Her papers include correspondence, manuscripts, videocassettes, various editions of her book Old Fashioned Recipe Book, and class schedules of the School of Country Living, which she opened in Kendrick, Idaho in 1976.

title: George H. Curtis Papers
subject: government and politics;scrapbooks;idaho;manuscripts

title: Farragut College and Technical Institute Records

title: Albert Edward Whitehead Papers
subject: professors;manuscripts;moscow

title: Gilbert H. Hogue Papers
subject: alumni;engineers and engineering;pacific northwest;diaries;moscow;genealogy
paragraph: Hogue received a degree in civil engineering from the University of Idaho in 1900. The papers include his diaries of travels throughout the Northwest as a surveyor and engineer for the U.S. Bureau of Reclamation, in addition to some family photographs.

title: Albert M. McPherson Papers
subject: alumni;engineers and engineering;genealogy;photographs;diaries;immigrants

subject: professors;agriculture;scrapbooks;photographs;moscow;engineers and engineering

title: John Jobson Papers
subject: authors and writers;recreation;photographs
paragraph: John Jobson was a Western outdoor sports writer and an authority on big game hunting in North America and Africa. This collection contains his personal papers.

title: William R. Meiners Papers
subject: environmental

subject: environmental;clubs and organizations

subject: forests;wildlife;photographs;recreation

title: Collection on Stanton G. Fisher
subject: settlers;indigenous;letters;wars;photographs;traders
paragraph: Writings and memorabilia of Stanton Gilbert Fisher, pioneer and Nez Perce War scout, 1840-1915. Most of the documents are Nez Perce War collectibles, such as maps, photographs, and accounts of the war and its participants. The rest of the papers are personal materials related to Fisher, including autobiographical materials as well as the correspondence and census records of several of his family members.

title: Betsy Thomas Papers
subject: womens rights;women;activists;clubs and organizations

From 1985-1997, Thomas was director of the University of Idaho Women’s Center where her work was seen as crucial in developing many Women’s Center programs and traditions. Also, landmark to Thomas’ career was her involvement in the National Organization for Women, which she was affiliated with beginning in 1976.

title: Richard Dodson Collection on E. E. "Doc" Smith and Science Fiction
subject: science fiction;manuscripts;authors and writers
paragraph: Richard W. Dodson (1915-2008) was a science fiction fan and American chemist who corresponded with science fiction authors, fans, and publishers throughout the 1930s and 1940s. The bulk of the collection documents his correspondence with E. E. (Edward Elmer) "Doc" Smith (1890-1965) who was a science fiction author and chemist known as the father of the "space opera." Their correspondence includes manuscripts (handwritten and typescript) for three books sent to Dodson by "Doc" Smith. Other correspondents include Clark Ashton Smith (1893-1961), Abraham Merritt (1884-1943), and others in the publishing industry. Dodson also corresponded with other science fiction fans such as Julius Schwartz and "George Zambock" who's real name was Allen Glasser. There are also newspaper clippings, artwork and photographs sent by the correspondents.

title: Herman W. Ronnenberg papers
subject: authors and writers;manuscripts
paragraph: This collection contains the research and manuscripts of Herman W. Ronnenberg. Ronnenberg was a University of Idaho graduate who wrote about the history of beer, particularly in Idaho and the Northwest, and the lives of the brewers.

title: Raymond and Helen Gatlin papers
subject: genealogy;moscow;business;fraternities and sororities
paragraph: Raymond Gatlin owned and operated the Sugar 'N Spice Bakery in Moscow, ID and Pullman, WA. This collection consists of some materials from his business, as well as family papers.

title: Idaho-Washington Concert Chorale publications
subject: moscow;clubs and organizations;music
paragraph: The Idaho-Washington Concert Choral performed from 2000-2011. This collection contains concert programs, posters, and newspaper clippings pertaining to the performances of the Chorale. In 2011, the organization changed its name to the Palouse Choral Society.

title: Leonard Loring papers
subject: labor unions;idaho

title: Preston L. Mabe papers
subject: wars;military

Fourt and his wife Ellen (O'Donnell) Fourt, their son John Edward Fourt and his wife Dorothy Lewis Perkins Fourt and their children. Collection includes genealogical information of Ellen O'Donnell's maternal ancestors Butler, Tenney, Ingalls, Roundtree, Murphy, and Ferguson families back to colonial New England, letters and photographs, items from Moscow High School (1940-1942) as well as a scrapbook of family-related newspaper clippings.

The collection also includes photographs taken by Schenck of the gym's construction as well as pictures of other buildings on campus and the construction of Arrowrock Dam on the Boise River around 1915.

title: Water Resources Research Institute Records
subject: water
paragraph: Collected research materials on Idaho water ways, 1942-1955; material relating to the Washington Hydro Study, 1960-1969; and other reports.

title: President's Office (Gibb) Records
paragraph: Correspondence, reports, and speeches relating to the administration of the University of Idaho.

title: WAMI (Medical Extension Program) Records
paragraph: Office files, course files, quarterly reports and other publications of the WAMI Medical Extension Program (a cooperative program between the University of Washington Medical School and universities in Washington, Alaska, Montana, and Idaho), office files concerning the undergraduate pre-medical, pre-dental program at the University of Idaho, and personal and research material of WAMI director Guy Anderson.

title: Financial Office Notebooks
subject: business
paragraph: Three files relating to university accounts: Idaho accounting book, appropriations history, and secretary's information notebook.

title: University Building Histories
subject: buildings and structures
paragraph: Insurance valuations (1953), photographs of University of Idaho buildings, and legal documents.

title: Irrigation Systems Research/Management (Pakistan Project) Records
subject: water;agriculture;correspondence;photographs
paragraph: Financial records, reports, papers concerning the procurement of equipment personnel files, correspondence and other office files, and photographs and slides of the Pakistan field office in the University of Idaho home office relating to a water resource management project in Lahore.

title: University of Idaho Research Office Records
subject: agriculture
paragraph: Grant proposals, budgets, progress reports, and copies of publications resulting from research grant awards.

title: Bureau of Public Affairs Research Records
paragraph: Grant applications and reports, information concerning seminars, workshops and institutes, correspondence and other material relating to publications, general correspondence, financial records and other papers concerning the Bureau of Public Affairs Research, a division of the Department of Political Science at the University of Idaho.

title: Agricultural Engineering Department Records
subject: agriculture;engineers and engineering;photographs;buildings and structures;correspondence;
paragraph: Photographs of agricultural buildings, implements, machinery, and methods, collected or taken by Professor John Dixon. Also included are annual reports of the Agricultural Engineering Dept. of the University of Idaho and correspondence, 1947-1969, concerning meetings of the Idaho Farm Electrification Committee.

title: Department of Animal Sciences Records
subject: photographs;farms and farming;
paragraph: Research material and student papers primarily concerned with dairy cows, dairy herd registrations, and photographs of the dairy herd. Also included are slides relating to poultry production.

title: University of Idaho Library Administration Records
subject: libraries
paragraph: Correspondence, memos, budget planning material and other records of library directors and assistant directors.

title: University of Idaho Library accession books
subject: libraries
paragraph: Accession books of the University of Idaho Library, recording author, title, publisher, cost, etc., of books acquired between 1906 and 1948.

title: University of Idaho Library inventory books
subject: libraries
paragraph: Lists of fixtures, supplies, furniture, and other apparatus in the University of Idaho Library, with value of items.

title: University of Idaho Library Technical Services Records
subject: libraries
paragraph: Correspondence, memos, and other material pertaining to Acquisitions, Cataloging, Serials/Periodicals, and Fiscal Officer/Gifts Librarian of the University of Idaho Library.

title: University of Idaho Library Public Services Records
subject: libraries
paragraph: Included in the records are correspondence, committee records of the Humanities and Science librarians, videotapes and other papers.

title: School of Family And Consumer Sciences Records
paragraph: Reports, minutes, planning documents, correspondence, scrapbooks, and photographic albums of the Department of Home Economics (now the School of Family and Consumer Sciences). Includes materials on department head Margaret Ritchie, on the Mary Hall Niccolls Scholarship Awards, and relating to auxiliary organizations such as Phi Upsilon Omicron, Student Home Economics Association, Idaho Home Economics Association, and Idaho Extension Homemakers Council.

title: University of Idaho Films
subject: students;athletics;interviews;
paragraph: Included in this collection are University ceremonies, commencements, interviews, campus construction, student projects, student plays, football games, and Vandaleer concerts.

title: Idaho Agricultural Experiment Station Records
subject: agriculture;photographs;correspondence
paragraph: Included in the records are correspondence, minutes of meetings, conference material, reports, research, and photographs. Most of the material relates to the Experiment Stations with one series in the group devoted to Agricultural Engineering.

title: Associated Women Students Records
subject: women;clubs and organizations;minutes
paragraph: The records include constitution, regulations, officer lists, constitutional amendments, duties of council members and committees, handbooks, meeting minutes, financial documents, and programs of social events.

title: Women's Center Records
subject: women;womens rights
paragraph: Included in the records are photographs, newspaper articles, lawsuits, a rape survey, budget and grant proposals, and various projects concerning the Women’s Center.

title: Reserve Officers' Training Corps (ROTC)
subject: military
paragraph: Records from the Army, Navy, and Air Force ROTC programs at the University of Idaho. The Navy ROTC records include documents related to Commander Roderick L. Mayer.

title: Maximum Gas Mileage Vehicle Project
paragraph: The Maximum Gas Mileage Vehicle Project was developed by E. Paul Cass and a group of students from the Mechanical Engineering Department to enter two competitions. It includes calculus and design for the vehicle and correspondence with sponsors and organizers of the competitions.

title: Postharvest Institute for Perishables Records
subject: agriculture
paragraph: The records include correspondence, reports, and other materials covering activities of the institute during the period.

title: Idaho Agricultural Experiment Station/WRCC Records
subject: agriculture;students;business;
paragraph: The records of the Idaho Agricultural Experiment Station (IAES)/Western Regional Coordinating Committee (WRCC) include research proposals and projects, correspondence, and other materials documenting the activities of the station under the direction of Raymond J. Miller.

title: Collection on Vandal Training and Scouting Films
paragraph: Digitizations of films and tapes of University of Idaho football games and men’s basketball games made for training and scouting purposes.

title: Idaho EPSCoR Records
subject: corresponence;minutes;professors;
paragraph: The records include correspondence, budgets, minutes of meetings, handouts, reports, and other materials documenting the activities of the project under the direction of University of Idaho Chemistry Professor Jean'ne M. Shreeve.

title: Department of Chemical Engineering. Industry Information Station Records
paragraph: Correspondence with member companies of the Council for Chemical Research to assist the Department of Chemical Engineering of the University of Idaho in establishing an "Industry Information Station" as a source for students choosing a career in the field.

title: University of Idaho Athena Records
subject: women;
paragraph: The University of Idaho Athena organization began in 1987 as a women's group for promoting the equitable climate for women, and providing professional development for campus women. This collection includes the records from the University of Idaho Athena organization spanning from 1987 to 2014. These include member lists, meeting minute notes, bylaws, newsletters, documents from the Women’s Leadership Conferences and Women in Higher Education Roundtable events, correspondence, treasurer’s reports, and research conducted by Athena.

title: University of Idaho Women's Recreation Association Photographs
subject: athletics;women;photographs;clubs and organizations;
paragraph: Photographs and film negatives of Women's Recreation Association board members, students, and activities.

title: University of Idaho Athletics Department letter award ledgers
subject: athletics
paragraph: This collection contains a list of students who have received varsity letters in athletics from the University of Idaho.

title: University of Idaho Mechanical Engineering Photographs
University of Idaho Athletics Vertical File
paragraph: Subject file created by the Special Collections and Archives staff focusing on topics frequently researched on athletics at the University of Idaho. Consists of materials, mostly of an ephemeral nature, collected and arranged for ready reference.

title: University of Idaho Campus Life and Culture Vertical File
paragraph: Subject file created by the Special Collections and Archives staff focusing on topics frequently researched on campus life and culture at the University of Idaho. Consists of materials, mostly of an ephemeral nature, collected and arranged for ready reference.

title: Idaho Subject Vertical File 1880-
subject: idaho
paragraph: Subject file created by the Special Collections and Archives staff focusing on topics frequently researched about Idaho. Consists of materials, mostly of an ephemeral nature, collected and arranged for ready reference.

title: Lionel Hampton Papers
paragraph: Lionel Hampton was a jazz vibraphonist, drummer, pianist, composer, and bandleader. The materials in this collection span most of his musical career. The collection includes personal papers and business records, photographs, musical compositions, audiotape master recordings (in a variety of formats), and six musical instruments, including a vibraphone.

title: Leonard Feather Papers
paragraph: Leonard Feather was a British journalist, jazz critic, producer, composer, and pianist. The collection contains his personal papers.

title: Al Grey and Rosalie Soladar Papers
paragraph: Al Grey was a jazz trombonist and bandleader. Rosalie Soladar was his companion and personal manager. Materials in this collection span most of Grey's career after their partnership. The collection includes contracts and schedules of Al Grey's engagements, correspondence, arrangements, clothing, artifacts and ephemera, audiotape master recordings, and a trombone.

title: Collection on Ella Fitzgerald
paragraph: Ella Fitzgerald was a jazz vocalist. This collection was assembled with materials acquired by the University of Idaho and donated to the Library in 1997. The collection includes personal items and artifacts that belonged to the artist.

title: Joe Williams Arrangements
paragraph: Joe Williams was a jazz vocalist. The collection consists mainly of arrangements, with a few other materials.

title: Buddy Tate Papers
paragraph: Buddy Tate was a jazz tenor saxophonist and clarinetist. The collection includes band books, performance suits, photographs, and ephemera.

title: Collection on Dizzy Gillespie
paragraph: Dizzy Gillespie was a jazz trumpeter, percussionist, pianist, and vocalist. This collection includes memorabilia that belonged to the artist.

title: Doc Cheatham Papers
paragraph: Doc Cheatham was a jazz trumpet player. The papers contain photographs, autobiography, manuscript scores, audiotapes, clothing, and miscellaneous items.

title: Stan Kenton Arrangements
paragraph: Stan Kenton was a jazz pianist, composer, and arranger. The collection consists of copies of arrangements.

title: Gerry Mulligan Digitized Scores
paragraph: Gerry Mulligan was a jazz saxophonist, composer, arranger, and bandleader. This collection consists mostly of digitized scores and other materials of the Gerry Mulligan Library. The Library of Congress holds the originals, which span the years circa 1940-1994. The materials were digitized in 2003.

title: Yuri Vermenich Collection on Jazz Ephemera
paragraph: Vermenich is a Russian jazz historian. The collection consists of fifteen signed photographs and nine letters from American jazz musicians, and seven books about jazz that he translated to Russian.

title: Small Collections on Jazz
paragraph: Memorabilia and other materials.

title: Conte Candoli Papers
paragraph: Conte Candoli was a jazz trumpeter. The papers include original music manuscripts and published sheet music either created or used by Conte Candoli during his career. They also include newspaper clippings, programs, photographs, awards, clothing, audio and video cassettes, and a Pocket Trumpet.

title: Pete Candoli Papers
paragraph: The majority of the Pete Candoli Papers consists of original music manuscripts, arrangements, muscial scores, and published sheet music either created or used by Pete Candoli throughout his career. Other items in the collection include correspondence, clothing, photographs and biographical information. Gift of Sheryl Deauville Candoli.

title: Lee Morse Collection
paragraph: Lee Morse was an American singer and songwriter. The collection includes mainly photographs and sound recordings.

title: Ray Brown Papers
paragraph: Ray Brown was an American jazz double bassist. The collection includes awards, photographs, videotapes, compact discs, ephemera, the Ray Brown bass method book, and five of his ties.

title: Jane Jarvis Papers
paragraph: Jane Jarvis was a jazz pianist. The collection includes newspaper clippings, concert fliers and programs, arrangements, scores, and a Thomas electronic organ.

title: Juhl Kauffman arrangements
subject: idaho;music
paragraph: This collection consists of arrangements and compositions by Idaho teacher and musician, Juhl F. Kauffman.

title: Day-Northwest Collection
subject: idaho;northwest
paragraph: This comprehensive collection consists of published materials for the study of Idaho and the Pacific Northwest. The materials included relate to persons, places, events, and things in and of the geographical area now known as the State of Idaho, together with materials that deal with Idaho's place in the region and the nation.

title: Caxton Collection
subject: publishing;americana
paragraph: The Caxton Collection, a gathering of all titles issued by Caxton printers, Ltd., of Caldwell, Idaho, has been brought together so that interested persons may study the publishing history of Idaho's only nationally known publisher. Since its beginnings early in the century, Caxton Printers has received many accolades for superlative craftsmanship and has been acclaimed as having 'recaptured the past in a long line of Western Americana.' Noted authors published by Caxton include Vardis Fisher and Ayn Rand. This collection contains over 1,000 volumes.

title: Stonewall Collection
subject: lgbtq
paragraph: The Stonewall Collection consists of books proposed for consideration for the American Library Association's Stonewall Book Awards (including winners and honor books) as representative of the stream of publishing representing the gay, lesbian, bisexual and transgender experience. The collection - including works added in the future - shall be incorporated into the Stonewall Book Awards Collection, presented by Lewis Brian Day.

title: Idaho Documents
subject: idaho;government and politics
paragraph: This collection of the publications of the State of Idaho and its subdivisions, including the University of Idaho, is considered to be one of the most complete in existence. Of special interest is the inclusion of a complete set of the territorial session laws and the journals of the territorial council and House of Representatives.

title: Ezra Pound Collection
subject: poetry;rare books
paragraph: In 1973 the Library began to collect works by and about Ezra Pound, American man of letters who was born in Hailey, Idaho, in 1885. The Pound Collection now contains over 300 titles including first editions, signed copies, and complete runs of Agenda and Paideuma.

title: Rare Books Collection
subject: rare books
paragraph: The Rare Book Collection consists of those books which because of their artifact or association qualities must be provided more attention and care. These include early imprints, such as incunabula (books published between 1450 and 1500); significant works from famous presses; volumes with exceptional bindings or illustrations; and first editions of landmark books, such as Charles Dickens' Little Dorritt as issued in twenty parts from 1825 through 1857. There are nearly 3000 volumes in this collection. In the bibliographic system these have the designation SPEC or DAY2 before the call number.

title: Sir Walter Scott Collection
subject: rare books
paragraph: This collection of first editions of the works of Sir Walter Scott, along with books relating to him, was presented to the University Library by Earl Larrison, Professor of Zoology, in 1962. Since that date, many volumes by or about the British writer have been added to the collection that now numbers over 1200 volumes.

title: Black Pioneers: Images of the Black Experience on the North American Frontier
subject: rare books;diversity, equity, and inclusion (dei);
paragraph: This book was published in 1997 and features photographs of the African-American experience in the western United States

subject: rare books;diversity, equity, and inclusion (dei);
paragraph: This book is a compendium of articles related to Afro-Americans that were published in Idaho newspapers during the years between the Emancipation Proclomation and the U.S. entry into World War I. Written by Black author, Dr. Mamie O. Oliver

paragraph: This book describes the role African Americans have played in the life and history of Idaho. Written by Black author, Dr. Mamie O. Oliver

paragraph: A publication about Chinese people and the Idaho gold rush in the 1800s.
image-alt: front cover of "Chinese in the Elk City Gold Fields" book

title: Chinese on the American Frontier
subject: rare books;diversity, equity, and inclusion (dei);
paragraph: A collection of articles related to the Chinese presence in the late 19th century in the western United States, when anti-Chinese sentiment was at its peak. Major themes include racial hostility and violence, Chinese resistance to discrimination, life in Chinatown, labor issues, and public attitudes. Written by Turkish author Arik Dirlik and Chinese author Malcolm Yeung
image-alt: front cover of "Chinese on the American Frontier" book

title: Historical Japanese Ceramic Comparative Collection
subject: diversity, equity, and inclusion (dei);
paragraph: Digital photographs and resources for identifying and describing Japanese ceramics manufactured during the Meiji, Taisho, and early Showa eras (roughly the mid-nineteenth and early twentieth centuries). This collection provides researchers with comparative examples of Japanese ceramics that are found on North American archaeological sites. The HJCCC is intended to assist in identification of historical Japanese ceramics, to encourage the use of standardized terminology, and to promote further research.
image-alt: decorative plate from the Asian American Comparative Collection

title: Japanese American Contributions to Idaho's Economic Development
subject: rare books;diversity, equity, and inclusion (dei);
paragraph: This discusses how "Japanese, like other early Idaho pioneers, came to the Gem State in search of economic opportunity. Through their efforts, they not only achieved many of their own economic goals, but also made significant contributions to Idaho's economic development."
image-alt: front cover of "Japanese Americans Contributions to Idaho's Economic Development" book

title: Japanese-Americans in the Pacific Northwest
subject: rare books;diversity, equity, and inclusion (dei);
paragraph: A bibliography of library resources relating to Japanese Americans in the Pacific Northwest. Created by Tacoma Public Library staff.
image-alt: front cover of "Japanese-Americans in the Pacific Northwest" bibliographic resource

title: Moving Forward While Looking Back
subject: diversity, equity, and inclusion (dei);
paragraph: This exhibit explores the impact that World War II had not only on those of Japanese ancestry in the United States, but also those in Japan who survived and rebuilt after the use of the atomic bomb and the role Idaho played through it all. It looks at the atrocities of war and the resilience and hope of those who live through it.
image-alt: Borah Foundation Peace Walk: Weeping European Larch

title: Rei Kihara Osaki in UI College of Law 2002 Annual Report
subject: diversity, equity, and inclusion (dei);
paragraph: Rei Kihara Osaki graduated from the U of I College of Law in 1943 was one of the College's first female students, its first Japanese-American graduate, and only the sixteenth woman in Idaho to become a lawyer. The 2002 Annual Report gives a biographical profile of Osaki's life.

paragraph: "We evaluated the internal controls over financial operations of the Idaho Commission on Hispanic Affairs as part of our effort to evaluate each State agency at least once every three years. This report summarizes the results of our evaluation."

title: Living Treasures: Hispanic Artisans & Traditionalists of the Snake River Valley
subject: diversity, equity, and inclusion (dei);
paragraph: Results of a survey of Traditional Hispanic Artists, documenting the variety and depth of traditional arts in the Hispanic Communities in southeastern oregon and southerwest Idaho. It recognizes the strength of a cultural history that has gone unrecognized throughout the region.
image-alt: front cover of "Living Treasures: Hispanic Artisans & Traditionalists of the Snake River Valley"

title: Report on the Governor's Hispanic Initiative, 1996-1997
subject: diversity, equity, and inclusion (dei);
paragraph: The attached report compiles recommendations from each of the five main components of the Governor's Hispanic Initiative. These five components include: Business and Employment, Education, Substance Abuse and Gangs, Accessibility, and Housing. The Idaho Commission on Hispanic Affairs committed itself to finalize these recommendations when this phase of the Initiative was turned over on July 15, 1997.
image-alt: front cover of the "Report on the Governor's Hispanic Initiative 1996-1997"

title: The Hispanic Profile Data Book for Idaho, 2004
subject: diversity, equity, and inclusion (dei);
paragraph: As the number of Hispanics in Idaho has increased over the course of the past two decades, the demand for demographic data and information regarding this population has increasingly become an essential resource for understanding and serving this community. In recognition of this need, during the summer of 2004 the Idaho Commission on Hispanic Affairs convened a statewide inter-agency task force to collaborate in the development of the Hispanic Profile Project, a demographic report of Idaho's Hispanic community.
image-alt: front cover of "The Hispanic Profile Data Book for Idaho"

title: Idaho Voters' Pamphlet, 1994
subject: diversity, equity, and inclusion (dei);
paragraph: Two propositions to be voted on at the general election (November 8, 1994). Proposition one, an act establishing state policies regarding homosexuality. Proposition two, an initiative establishing term limits for elected federal, state, county, municipal, and school district officials.
image-alt: Idaho Voters' Pamphlet regarding LGBTQ+ rights

title: Same-Sex Affairs: Constructing and Controlling Homosexuality in the Pacific Northwest
subject: diversity, equity, and inclusion (dei);
paragraph: At the turn of the twentieth century, two distinct, yet at times overlapping, male same-sex sexual subcultures had emerged in the Pacific Northwest: one among the men and boys who toiled in the region's logging, fishing, mining, farming, and railroad-building industries; the other among the young urban white-collar workers of the emerging corporate order. Boag draws on police logs, court records, and newspaper accounts to create a vivid picture of the lives of these men and youths — their sexual practices, cultural networks, cross-class relations, variations in rural and urban experiences, and ethnic and racial influences.
image-alt: cover page of "Same-Sex Affairs: Constructing and Controlling Homosexuality in the Pacific Northwest"

title: The Boys of Boise: Furor, Vice & Folly in an American City
subject: diversity, equity, and inclusion (dei);
paragraph: "Written in 1965 about a same-sex sexual scandal that occured in 1955 in Boise, Idaho, John Gerassi's classic study depicts both middle America's traditional response to homosexuality and an era in the country's history before the modern gay rights movement really got underway." - Peter Boag "On the morning of November 2, 1955, the people of Boise, Idaho, were stunned by a screaming headline in the *Idaho Daily Statesman*, THREE BOISE MEN ADMIT SEX CHARGES. *Time* magazine picked up the story, reporting that a 'homosexual underworld' had long operated in Idaho's staid capital city. The *Statesman* led the hysteria that resulted in dozens of arrests - including some highly placed members of the community - and sentences ranging from probation to life imprisonment."
image-alt: front cover of "The Boys of Boise: Furor, Vice & Folly in an American City"

title: Voices of Gay Rodeo
subject: diversity, equity, and inclusion (dei);
paragraph: Partnering with the International Gay Rodeo Association to collect and preserve people’s experiences as LGBTQ+ westerners, this project seeks to protect endangered histories and relocate LGBTQ+ people back into the American West as people continue to build resilient communities.
image-alt: horse

title: A Cold Wind From Idaho
subject: diversity, equity, and inclusion (dei);
paragraph: "Matsuda's poems break for us all the Japanese-American code of silence (gaman) toward the indignities of the nine U.S. government-mandated internment camps of WWII like Minidoka in Idaho where Matsuda was born. He not only educates us in the specifics of the suffering of this time, but also brings us into the transgenerational implications of it, connecting this shameful period to both the war in Iraq and the bombing of Hiroshima where one of his relatives survived near ground zero." - Tess Gallagher
image-alt: front cover of "A Cold Wind From Idaho"

title: Idaho Queered: Proud Histories from the Gem State
subject: diversity, equity, and inclusion (dei);lgbtq;
paragraph: Idaho Queered is a collection of LGBTQ+ Oral Histories that were recorded during 2017-2018. Featuring interviews with queer Idahoans that detail their experiences with coming out, fighting discrimination, and navigating the particular challenges of their lives, the project aims to help preserve LGBTQ history through audio and video storytelling.
